intro: Cyrtandra nukuhivensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in montane habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
